sentences.english: Be aware of your customer's fears and hesitations.
sentences.chinese: 注意客户的担心和迟疑。

sentences.english: And don't hesitate to dial 911 if you think you or another family member is in immediate danger.
sentences.chinese: 如果家中有人非常危险，请毫不迟疑地拨打911。

sentences.english: He accepted the job offer without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不迟疑的接受了这个工作。

sentences.english: Don't hesitate in killing him with your finger.
sentences.chinese: 不要迟疑，用你的指尖捏死他。

sentences.english: No hesitation at all, just her wide smile.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不迟疑，她只是开怀大笑。

sentences.english: Without hesitation, she strapped on a pair of snowshoes and headed out into the snow.
sentences.chinese: 她没有半点迟疑，就绑紧雪鞋走进雪里。
我迟疑地向艾思梅微笑。

sentences.english: She came in and set on the edge of the chair, hesitantly .
sentences.chinese: 她迟疑地走了进来，小心地坐在椅子的边缘。

sentences.english: He did not hesitate to subtract terms with literal coefficients.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不迟疑地进行了文字系数项的相减。

sentences.english: She hesitated, but of course she meant to.
sentences.chinese: 她迟疑了一下，当然她本意在如此。

sentences.english: He paused slightly, then pointed to the middle rectangle: red .
sentences.chinese: 他迟疑了一下，然后指向中间的红色矩形。

sentences.english: The hesitation has brought stern warnings.
sentences.chinese: 这一迟疑不决的态度已招致严重警告。

sentences.english: If you do find one, don't hesitate to make a car. It is very funny!
sentences.chinese: 但如果你找到空线辘，别迟疑造架车，非常好玩的。

sentences.english: Most officials are adamant that the policy remains in place.
sentences.chinese: 很多官员在迟疑是否要保留这项政策。

sentences.english: Hesitating a moment, she added three one-rupee notes to it.
sentences.chinese: 迟疑了片刻，她又加了三张一卢比的纸币。

sentences.english: I've been stumbling in the dark, living in a crash world.
sentences.chinese: 我生活在一个堕落的的世界已经在黑暗中迟疑不前。

definition: to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank/(coll.) unexpectedly/rash/rashly
to ponder/to reckon/to turn sth over in one's mind
to have heard what was said
